briefdescription.para: determines if a point is on a sharp feature edge from a point set for which the Voronoi covariance Measures have been computed.

detaileddescription.para: The sharpness of the edge, specified by parameter threshold, is used to filtered points according to the external angle around a sharp feature.

A point is considered to be on a sharp feature if the external angle alpha at the edge is such that alpha >= 2 / sqrt(3) * sqrt(threshold). In particular this means that if the input contains sharp features with different external angles, the one with the smallest external angle should be considered, which however would result in selecting more points on sharper regions. More details are provided in [7].

parameterdescription.para: is a model of DiagonalizeTraits. It can be omitted: if Eigen 3 (or greater) is available and CGAL_EIGEN3_ENABLED is defined then an overload using Eigen_diagonalize_traits is provided. Otherwise, the internal implementation Diagonalize_traits is used.

simplesect.para: CGAL::compute_vcm()`

memberdef.argsstring: (const PointRange &points, std::vector< cpp11::array< double, 6 > > &ccov, double offset_radius, double convolution_radius, const NamedParameters &np)
memberdef.name: compute_vcm

briefdescription.para: computes the Voronoi Covariance Measure (VCM) of a point cloud, a construction that can be used for normal estimation and sharp feature detection.

detaileddescription.para: The VCM associates to each point the covariance matrix of its Voronoi cell intersected with the ball of radius offset_radius. In addition, if the second radius convolution_radius is positive, the covariance matrices are smoothed via a convolution process. More specifically, each covariance matrix is replaced by the average of the matrices of the points located at a distance at most convolution_radius. The choice for parameter offset_radius should refer to the geometry of the underlying surface while the choice for parameter convolution_radius should refer to the noise level in the point cloud. For example, if the point cloud is a uniform and noise-free sampling of a smooth surface, offset_radius should be set to the minimum local feature size of the surface, while convolution_radius can be set to zero.
The Voronoi covariance matrix of each vertex is stored in an array a of length 6 and is as follow:

parameterdescription.para: is a model of Range. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
output range of covariance matrices.
offset_radius.
convolution_radius.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

memberdef.argsstring: (PointRange &points, double offset_radius, double convolution_radius, const NamedParameters &np)

an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

memberdef.name: structure_point_set

briefdescription.para: This is an implementation of the Point Set Structuring algorithm.

detaileddescription.para: This algorithm takes advantage of a set of detected planes: it detects adjacency relationships between planes and resamples the detected planes, edges and corners to produce a structured point set.
The size parameter epsilon is used both for detecting adjacencies and for setting the sampling density of the structured point set.
For more details, please refer to [6].

parameterdescription.para: is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter plane_map.
Type of the output iterator. The type of the objects put in it is std::pair<Kernel::Point_3, Kernel::Vector_3>. Note that the user may use a function_output_iterator to match specific needs.
input point range.
input plane range.
output iterator where output points are written
size parameter.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Vector_3.
a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type int. Associates the index of a point in the input range to the index of plane (-1 if point does is not assigned to a plane).
a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Plane_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Plane_3> is used.
multiple of epsilon used to connect simplices.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

briefdescription.para: Orients the normals of the range of points using the propagation of a seed orientation through a minimum spanning tree of the Riemannian graph.

detaileddescription.para: This method modifies the order of input points so as to pack all sucessfully oriented points first, and returns an iterator over the first point with an unoriented normal (see erase-remove idiom). For this reason it should not be called on sorted containers. It is based on [3].

simplesect.para: This function may fail when Boost version 1.54 is used, because of the following bug: https://svn.boost.org/trac/boost/ticket/9012
Normals must be unit vectors

parameterdescription.para: is a model of Range. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
number of neighbors.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Vector_3.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: iterator over the first point with an unoriented normal.

briefdescription.para: This is an implementation of the Weighted Locally Optimal Projection (WLOP) simplification algorithm.

detaileddescription.para: The WLOP simplification algorithm can produce a set of denoised, outlier-free and evenly distributed particles over the original dense point cloud. The core of the algorithm is a Weighted Locally Optimal Projection operator with a density uniformization term. For more details, please refer to [4].

A parallel version of WLOP is provided and requires the executable to be linked against the Intel TBB library. To control the number of threads used, the user may use the tbb::task_scheduler_init class. See the TBB documentation for more details.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag and Parallel_tag.
is a model of Range. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
Type of the output iterator. It must accept objects of type geom_traits::Point_3.
input point range.
iterator where output points are put.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Vector_3.
percentage of points to retain. The default value is set to 5 (%).

spherical neighborhood radius. This is a key parameter that needs to be finely tuned. The result will be irregular if too small, but a larger value will impact the runtime. In practice, choosing a radius such that the neighborhood of each sample point includes at least two rings of neighboring sample points gives satisfactory result. The default value is set to 8 times the average spacing of the point set.
number of iterations to solve the optimsation problem. The default value is 35. More iterations give a more regular result but increase the runtime.
an optional preprocessing, which will give better result if the distribution of the input points is highly non-uniform. The default value is false.

an instance of cpp11::function<bool(double)>. It is called regularly when the algorithm is running: the current advancement (between 0. and 1.) is passed as parameter. If it returns true, then the algorithm continues its execution normally; if it returns false, the algorithm is stopped, no output points are generated.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

briefdescription.para: This function smooths an input point set by iteratively projecting each point onto the implicit surface patch fitted over its k nearest neighbors.

detaileddescription.para: Bilateral projection preserves sharp features according to the normal (gradient) information. Both point positions and normals will be modified. For more details, please see section 4 in [5].

A parallel version of this function is provided and requires the executable to be linked against the Intel TBB library. To control the number of threads used, the user may use the tbb::task_scheduler_init class. See the TBB documentation for more details.

simplesect.para: Normals must be unit vectors

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag And Parallel_tag.
is a model of Range. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
size of the neighborhood for the implicit surface patch fitting. The larger the value is, the smoother the result will be.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Vector_3.
controls the sharpness of the result.

an instance of cpp11::function<bool(double)>. It is called regularly when the algorithm is running: the current advancement (between 0. and 1.) is passed as parameter. If it returns true, then the algorithm continues its execution normally; if it returns false, the algorithm is stopped, all points are left unchanged and the function return NaN.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: Average point movement error. It's a convergence criterium for the algorithm. This value can help the user to decide how many iterations are sufficient.

briefdescription.para: This method progressively upsamples the point set while approaching the edge singularities (detected by normal variation), which generates a denser point set from an input point set.

detaileddescription.para: This has applications in point-based rendering, hole filling, and sparse surface reconstruction. Normals of points are required as input. For more details, please refer to [5].

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel versions of compute_average_spacing() (called internally). Possible values are Sequential_tag and Parallel_tag.
is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.

Type of the output iterator. The type of the objects put in it is std::pair<geom_traits::Point_3, geom_traits::Vector_3>. Note that the user may use a function_output_iterator to match specific needs.
input point range.
iterator where output points and normals are put.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Vector_3.
controls the sharpness of the result.
controls the priority of points inserted along sharp features. See section Parameter: edge_sensitivity for an example.
spherical neighborhood radius.
is the number of output points to generate.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

briefdescription.para: Recursively split the point set in smaller clusters until the clusters have less than size elements or until their variation factor is below var_max.

detaileddescription.para: This method modifies the order of input points so as to pack all remaining points first, and returns an iterator over the first point to remove (see erase-remove idiom). For this reason it should not be called on sorted containers.

parameterdescription.para: is a model of Range. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
maximum cluster size.
maximum cluster variation value.

a model of DiagonalizeTraits. It can be omitted: if Eigen 3 (or greater) is available and CGAL_EIGEN3_ENABLED is defined then an overload using Eigen_diagonalize_traits is provided. Otherwise, the internal implementation CGAL::Diagonalize_traits is used.

an instance of cpp11::function<bool(double)>. It is called regularly when the algorithm is running: the current advancement (between 0. and 1.) is passed as parameter. If it returns true, then the algorithm continues its execution normally; if it returns false, the algorithm is stopped and simplification stops with no guarantee on the output.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: iterator over the first point to remove.

briefdescription.para: Randomly deletes a user-specified fraction of the input points.

detaileddescription.para: This method modifies the order of input points so as to pack all remaining points first, and returns an iterator over the first point to remove (see erase-remove idiom). For this reason it should not be called on sorted containers.

parameterdescription.para: is a model of Range.
input point range.
percentage of points to remove.

simplesect.para: iterator over the first point to remove.

briefdescription.para: Smoothes the range of points using jet fitting on the k nearest neighbors and reprojection onto the jet.

detaileddescription.para: As this method relocates the points, it should not be called on containers sorted w.r.t. point locations.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag and Parallel_tag.
is a model of Range. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
number of neighbors
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
degree of jet fitting.
Monge degree.
template parameter for the class Monge_via_jet_fitting. If Eigen 3.2 (or greater) is available and CGAL_EIGEN3_ENABLED is defined, then CGAL::Eigen_svd is used.

an instance of cpp11::function<bool(double)>. It is called regularly when the algorithm is running: the current advancement (between 0. and 1.) is passed as parameter. If it returns true, then the algorithm continues its execution normally; if it returns false, the algorithm is stopped and the remaining points are left unchanged.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

an instance of cpp11::function<bool(double)>. It is called regularly when the algorithm is running: the current advancement (between 0. and 1.) is passed as parameter. If it returns true, then the algorithm continues its execution normally; if it returns false, the algorithm is stopped and the average spacing value estimated on the processed subset is returned.

briefdescription.para: Reads points (positions + normals, if available) from a .off ASCII stream.

detaileddescription.para: The function expects for each point a line with the x y z position, optionally followed by the nx ny nz normal. Faces are ignored.

parameterdescription.para: type of objects that can be put in OutputIterator. It is default to value_type_traits<OutputIterator>::type and can be omitted when the default is fine.

output iterator over points.

a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Vector_3. If this parameter is omitted, normals in the input stream are ignored.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: true on success.

memberdef.name: make_las_point_reader

briefdescription.para: Generates a LAS property handler to read 3D points.

detaileddescription.para: Points are constructed from the input the using 3 LAS properties LAS_property::X, LAS_property::Y and LAS_property::Z.

parameterdescription.para: the property map used to store points.

briefdescription.para: Reads user-selected points properties from a .las or .laz stream.

detaileddescription.para: Potential additional properties are ignored.
Properties are handled through a variadic list of property handlers. A PropertyHandler can either be:

listitem.para: A std::pair<PropertyMap, LAS_property::Tag > if the user wants to read a LAS property as a scalar value LAS_property::Tag::type (for example, storing an int LAS property into an int variable).

A std::tuple<PropertyMap, Constructor, LAS_property::Tag...> if the user wants to use one or several LAS properties to construct a complex object (for example, storing 4 unsigned short LAS properties into a Color object that can for example be a CGAL::cpp11::array<unsigned short, 4>). In that case, the second element of the tuple should be a functor that constructs the value type of PropertyMap from N objects of of type LAS_property::Tag::type.

detaileddescription.para: The LAS standard defines a fixed set of properties accessible through the following tag classes:

simplesect.para: This function requires a C++11 compiler.

parameterdescription.para: type of objects that can be put in OutputIterator. It is default to value_type_traits<OutputIterator>::type and can be omitted when the default is fine.
iterator over output points.
handlers to recover properties.

simplesect.para: true on success.

detaileddescription.para: PLY is either ASCII or binary depending on the value of CGAL::get_mode(stream).
Properties are handled through a variadic list of property handlers. A PropertyHandler can either be:

listitem.para: A std::pair<PropertyMap, PLY_property<T> > if the user wants to write a scalar value T as a PLY property (for example, writing an int variable as an int PLY property).

A std::tuple<PropertyMap, PLY_property<T>...> if the user wants to write a complex object as several PLY properties. In that case, a specialization of Output_rep must be provided for PropertyMap::value_type that handles both ASCII and binary output (see CGAL::get_mode()).

Saves the range of points with properties to a .las stream.

detaileddescription.para: Properties are handled through a variadic list of property handlers. A PropertyHandle is a std::pair<PropertyMap, LAS_property::Tag > used to write a scalar value LAS_property::Tag::type as a LAS property (for example, writing an int vairable as an int LAS property). An exception is used for points that are written using a std::tuple object.
See documentation of read_las_points_with_properties() for the list of available LAS_property::Tag classes.

simplesect.para: This function requires a C++11 compiler.

parameterdescription.para: is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
is a model of ReadablePropertyMap with a value_type = CGAL::Point_3.
handlers to recover properties.

simplesect.para: true on success.

briefdescription.para: Saves the range of points (positions only) to a .las stream.

parameterdescription.para: is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
output stream.
input point range.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: true on success.
This function requires a C++11 compiler.

briefdescription.para: Reads points (positions + normals, if available) from a .xyz ASCII stream.

detaileddescription.para: The function expects for each point a line with the x y z position, optionally followed by the nx ny nz normal. The first line may contain the number of points in the file. Empty lines and comments starting by # character are allowed.

parameterdescription.para: type of objects that can be put in OutputIterator. It is default to value_type_traits<OutputIterator>::type and can be omitted when the default is fine.
iterator over output points.
input stream.
output iterator over points.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of WritablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Vector_3. If this parameter is omitted, normals in the input stream are ignored.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: true on success.

briefdescription.para: Estimates normal directions of the range of points using jet fitting on the k nearest neighbors.

detaileddescription.para: The output normals are randomly oriented.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag and Parallel_tag.
is a model of Range. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
number of neighbors
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Vector_3.
degree of jet fitting.
template parameter for the class Monge_via_jet_fitting. If Eigen 3.2 (or greater) is available and CGAL_EIGEN3_ENABLED is defined, then CGAL::Eigen_svd is used.

an instance of cpp11::function<bool(double)>. It is called regularly when the algorithm is running: the current advancement (between 0. and 1.) is passed as parameter. If it returns true, then the algorithm continues its execution normally; if it returns false, the algorithm is stopped and the remaining normals are left unchanged.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

memberdef.argsstring: (const PointRange &points, const QueryPointRange &queries, OutputIterator output, const NamedParameters &np)
memberdef.name: estimate_local_k_neighbor_scales

briefdescription.para: Estimates the local scale in a K nearest neighbors sense on a set of user-defined query points.

detaileddescription.para: The computed scales correspond to the smallest scales such that the K subsets of points have the appearance of a surface in 3D or the appearance of a curve in 2D (see Automatic Scale Estimation).

parameterdescription.para: is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter query_point_map.
is used to store the computed scales. It accepts values of type std::size_t.
input point range.
range of locations where scale must be estimated
iterator to store the computed scales
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3 (or geom_traits::Point_2). If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> (or CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_2>) is used.

a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3 (or geom_traits::Point_2). If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> (or CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_2>) is used.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: This function accepts both 2D and 3D points, but sample points and query must have the same dimension.

briefdescription.para: Estimates the global scale in a K nearest neighbors sense.

detaileddescription.para: The computed scale corresponds to the smallest scale such that the K subsets of points have the appearance of a surface in 3D or the appearance of a curve in 2D (see Automatic Scale Estimation).

parameterdescription.para: is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3 (or geom_traits::Point_2). If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> (or CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_2>) is used.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: This function accepts both 2D and 3D points.
The estimated scale in the K nearest neighbors sense.

memberdef.name: estimate_local_range_scales

briefdescription.para: Estimates the local scale in a range sense on a set of user-defined query points.

detaileddescription.para: The computed scales correspond to the smallest scales such that the subsets of points included in the sphere range have the appearance of a surface in 3D or the appearance of a curve in 2D (see Automatic Scale Estimation).

parameterdescription.para: is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter query_point_map.
is used to store the computed scales. It accepts values of type geom_traits::FT.
input point range.
range of locations where scale must be estimated
iterator to store the computed scales
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3 (or geom_traits::Point_2). If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> (or CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_2>) is used.

a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3 (or geom_traits::Point_2). If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> (or CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_2>) is used.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: This function accepts both 2D and 3D points, but sample points and query must have the same dimension.

briefdescription.para: Estimates the global scale in a range sense.

detaileddescription.para: The computed scale corresponds to the smallest scale such that the subsets of points inside the sphere range have the appearance of a surface in 3D or the appearance of a curve in 2D (see Automatic Scale Estimation).

parameterdescription.para: is a model of ConstRange. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3 (or geom_traits::Point_2). If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> (or CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_2>) is used.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: This function accepts both 2D and 3D points.

The estimated scale in the range sense. The return type FT is a number type. It is either deduced from the geom_traits Named Parameters if provided, or the geometric traits class deduced from the point property map of points.

briefdescription.para: Estimates normal directions of the range of points by linear least squares fitting of a plane over the k nearest neighbors.

detaileddescription.para: The output normals are randomly oriented.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag and Parallel_tag.
is a model of Range. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
number of neighbors
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
a model of WritablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Vector_3.

an instance of cpp11::function<bool(double)>. It is called regularly when the algorithm is running: the current advancement (between 0. and 1.) is passed as parameter. If it returns true, then the algorithm continues its execution normally; if it returns false, the algorithm is stopped and the remaining normals are left unchanged.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

briefdescription.para: Removes outliers:

listitem.para: computes average squared distance to the K nearest neighbors,
and sorts the points in increasing order of average distance.

detaileddescription.para: This method modifies the order of input points so as to pack all remaining points first, and returns an iterator over the first point to remove (see erase-remove idiom). For this reason it should not be called on sorted containers.

parameterdescription.para: is a model of Range. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
number of neighbors
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadablePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.
maximum percentage of points to remove.
minimum distance for a point to be considered as outlier (distance here is the square root of the average squared distance to K nearest neighbors).

an instance of cpp11::function<bool(double)>. It is called regularly when the algorithm is running: the current advancement (between 0. and 1.) is passed as parameter. If it returns true, then the algorithm continues its execution normally; if it returns false, the algorithm is stopped, all points are left unchanged and the function return points.end().
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: iterator over the first point to remove.

There are two thresholds that can be used: threshold_percent and threshold_distance. This function returns the smallest number of outliers such that at least one of these threshold is fullfilled. This means that if threshold_percent=100, only threshold_distance is taken into account; if threshold_distance=0 only threshold_percent is taken into account.

briefdescription.para: Merges points which belong to the same cell of a grid of cell size = epsilon.

detaileddescription.para: This method modifies the order of input points so as to pack all remaining points first, and returns an iterator over the first point to remove (see erase-remove idiom). For this reason it should not be called on sorted containers.

parameterdescription.para: is a model of Range. The value type of its iterator is the key type of the named parameter point_map.
input point range.
tolerance value when merging 3D points.
optional sequence of Named Parameters among the ones listed below.

entry.para: a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with value type geom_traits::Point_3. If this parameter is omitted, CGAL::Identity_property_map<geom_traits::Point_3> is used.

an instance of cpp11::function<bool(double)>. It is called regularly when the algorithm is running: the current advancement (between 0. and 1.) is passed as parameter. If it returns true, then the algorithm continues its execution normally; if it returns false, the algorithm is stopped and simplification stops with no guarantee on the output.
an instance of a geometric traits class, model of Kernel

simplesect.para: iterator over the first point to remove.
